name: John McSHAW v. WORKMEN'S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON). Appeal of WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON
name_abbreviation: McShaw v. Workmen's Compensation Appeal Board

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE and NIGRO, JJ.
NEWMAN, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: John McSHAW v. WORKMEN’S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON). Appeal of WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
NEWMAN, J., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Wilbur C. Creveling, Jr., James T. Anthony, Allentown, for Waste Manage.'
Chester C. Corse, Pottsville, for McShaw.
casebody.head_matter:
670 A.2d 1151
John McSHAW v. WORKMEN’S COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON). Appeal of WASTE MANAGEMENT OF HAZLETON.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 24, 1996.
Decided Feb. 13, 1996.
Wilbur C. Creveling, Jr., James T. Anthony, Allentown, for Waste Manage.'
Chester C. Corse, Pottsville, for McShaw.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE and NIGRO, JJ.
